Serialized Form

  • Package <Unnamed>

    • Class Car extends CollidableRectangle implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • xSpeed

          double xSpeed
          The Car speed on the x-axis (positive means on the right, negative on the left) ([-8,8])

        • ySpeed

          double ySpeed
          The Car speed on the y-axis ([0.5,2] for civilans, [0.5,3.58] for racers, [0.5,4.64] for player. Can be 0 if blocked or greater than the max if pushed. Multiply by 50 to obtain the speed in Km/h.

        • xAcc

          int xAcc
          The Car acceleration on the x-axis ([-4,4])

        • yAcc

          int yAcc
          The Car acceleration on the y-axis ([-8,4])

        • Racer

          boolean Racer
          The Car type (true = racer, false = civilian)

        • bustedTime

          int bustedTime
          The number of 50ms rounds during which the car is busted by the police (default : 0)

        • bustedSpeed

          int bustedSpeed
          The speed at which the car was busted (default : 0)

    • Class Client extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • gui

          Gui gui
          Instance of the client GUI

        • server

          IServer server
          Server's stub

        • serverAddress

          java.lang.String serverAddress
          Server's IP address

        • uuid

          java.util.UUID uuid
          UUID attributed by the server

    • Class CollidableRectangle extends Rectangle implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • effect

          int effect
          Detemines the effect that a collision with this rectangle has: 0 (block), 1 (bounce), 2 (slow down), 3 (finishes the game), 4 (Speed control)

    • Class Gui extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • image

          java.awt.image.BufferedImage image
          The image to refresh

        • g2

          java.awt.Graphics2D g2
          The graphics environment which can be used to draw squares or pictures in the BufferedImage

        • jpBoard

          MyJPanel jpBoard
          The doubleBuffered JPanel which contains the BufferedImage

        • myCar

          Car myCar
          A copy of the instance of the car that the player controls

        • engine

          IGameEngine engine

        • jButton1

          javax.swing.JButton jButton1

        • jLabel1

          javax.swing.JLabel jLabel1

        • jYourScore

          javax.swing.JTextField jYourScore

    • Class MyJPanel extends javax.swing.JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • image

          java.awt.image.BufferedImage image
          The BufferedImage to paint

    • Class Player extends Car implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • core

          Core core
          Reference to the core containing this Player

        • gui

          IGui gui
          The client's stub

        • connected

          boolean connected
          True if the client is connected

        • upKeyPressed

          boolean upKeyPressed
          True if the player is pressing the up arrow key

        • downKeyPressed

          boolean downKeyPressed
          True if the player is pressing the down arrow key

        • rightKeyPressed

          boolean rightKeyPressed
          True if the player is pressing the right arrow key

        • leftKeyPressed

          boolean leftKeyPressed
          True if the player is pressing the left arrow key

        • position

          int position
          Integer representation of the final position (rank) of the player after passing the finish line

        • score

          int score
          The player's score

        • finishLineCrossed

          boolean finishLineCrossed
          True if the player crossed the finish line

        • displayedRoad

          java.util.Vector<E> displayedRoad
          Road segments to display for this player

        • displayedObstacles

          java.util.Vector<E> displayedObstacles
          Obstacles to display for this player

        • displayedCars

          java.util.Vector<E> displayedCars
          Cars to display for this player

        • readyToStart

          boolean readyToStart
          True if this player's client pressed the start button

    • Class Rectangle extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • x

          double x
          Rectangle position on the x-axis

        • y

          double y
          Rectangle position on the y-axis

        • width

          int width
          Rectangle width

        • height

          int height
          Rectangle height

        • id

          int id
          Rectangle id which corresponds to: 0 (Grass land), 1 (Road segment), 2 (White separator (or finish line)), 3 (Road border), 4 (Tree), 5 (Concrete Block), 6 (Red car (player)), 7 (White car (opponent)), 8 (Blue car (civilian)), 9 (Camera view), 10 (Red rectangle (for collision warning)), 11 (Speed limitation sign), 12 (Police car), 13 (Speed control zone) or 14 (Speed display sign)

    • Class Server extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • currentCore

          Core currentCore
          A core waiting for other players

        • playersCountPerGame

          int playersCountPerGame
          Number of player a core should contain before starting

        • playersByUuid

          java.util.HashMap<K,V> playersByUuid
          Association between a Player and his Universal Unique ID
